items.description: To create a new Form Tour, type 'new form tour' in the awesomebar and hit enter. You will need to enter a title, select a reference DocType, and add steps for each field.
items.example: // Navigate to 'new form tour' via the awesomebar to start creating a tour.

items.description: Key configuration options for a Form Tour document.
items.example:
/*
- Is Standard: Makes the tour a standard one stored as JSON (developer mode only).
- Save on Completion: Prompts the user to save the document at the end of the tour.
- Show First Document Tour: Shows the tour on the first existing document instead of a new form.
- Include Name Field: Makes the 'name' field the first step of the tour.
*/

items.description: Key configuration options for each step in a Form Tour.
items.example:
/*
- Field: The field to be highlighted.
- Title & Description: Text to describe the highlighted field.
- Position: Position of the popover (e.g., 'Top', 'Bottom', 'Left', 'Right').
- Next Condition: A JavaScript condition (e.g., 'eval: doc.priority != ""') that must be met to proceed to the next step.
- Is Table Field: Check if the field is within a child table.
- Parent Field: The parent table field if 'Is Table Field' is checked.
*/

items.description: Initializes and starts a Form Tour. This is typically done in the 'onload' event of a form script.
